wikipedia_page.main: Allan Heywood Bright (24 May 1862 – 3 August 1941) was a British Liberal politician.

response: *Allan Heywood Bright (1862–1941), Liberal MP for Oswestry (1904–1906)
Allan Heywood Bright MP, Sir Wilfrid Lawson MP,

The local Liberal Association selected 42-year-old Allan Heywood Bright as their candidate to gain the seat. He had been the Liberal candidate at the previous election in 1901. Previously he had contested Exeter in 1899 and 1900. He had a residence at Weston Rhyn near Oswestry.The Times noted that he had "nursed the constituency assidiously of late".
